sn45.4:4.2: Then Venerable Ānanda robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robes, entered Sāvatthī for alms.
sn45.4:4.3: He saw the brahmin Jāṇussoṇi driving out of Sāvatthī in a splendid all-white chariot drawn by mares.
sn45.4:4.4: The yoked horses were pure white, as were the ornaments, chariot, upholstery, reins, goad, and canopy. And his turban, robes, sandals were white, as was the chowry fanning him.
sn45.4:4.5: When people saw it they exclaimed:
sn45.4:4.7: It’s a vehicle fit for Brahmā!”
sn45.4:5.1: Then Ānanda wandered for alms in Sāvatthī. After the meal, on his return from alms-round, he went to the Buddha,
sn45.4:5.2: bowed, sat down to one side,
sn45.4:5.3: and told him what had happened.
sn45.4:6.7: “Sir, can you point out a Brahmā vehicle in this teaching and training?”
sn45.4:7.2: “These are all terms for the noble eightfold path:
sn45.4:7.3: ‘vehicle of Brahmā’, or else ‘vehicle of truth’, or else ‘supreme victory in battle’.
sn45.4:8.1: When right view is developed and cultivated it culminates with the getting rid of greed, hate, and delusion.
sn45.4:8.13: right samādhi is developed and cultivated it culminates with the getting rid of greed, hate, and delusion.
sn45.4:9.1: This is a way to understand how these are all terms for the noble eightfold path:
sn45.4:9.2: ‘vehicle of Brahmā’, or else ‘vehicle of truth’, or else ‘supreme victory in battle’.
sn45.4:9.3: This is what the Buddha said.
